Benchmark: Share ideas orally about Jewish stories, holidays, and values using age‑appropriate vocabulary.
Express a simple personal connection to a story, mitzvah, or holiday (“This reminds me of…”, “I can do…”).
Participate in structured discussions and chevruta, building on peers’ ideas and referencing texts.
Write short explanatory and argumentative paragraphs about Jewish texts, history, or values, using textual evidence.
Reflect in writing or speech on how Jewish ideas and history influence their own identity and choices.
Lead or co‑lead text‑based discussions, framing questions and integrating multiple sources.
Produce extended analytical and argumentative writing that integrates Jewish sources and historical context.
Articulate a nuanced personal relationship to Jewish peoplehood, practice, and Israel, referencing learning from texts and history.
